metadata.title: CVE-2015-7560 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
The SMB1 implementation in smbd in Samba 3.x and 4.x before 4.1.23, 4.2.xbefore 4.2.9, 4.3.x before 4.3.6, and 4.4.x before 4.4.0rc4 allows remoteauthenticated users to modify arbitrary ACLs by using a UNIX SMB1 call tocreate a symlink, and then using a non-UNIX SMB1 call to write to the ACLcontent.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-7560` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
libpam-winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
libsmbclient - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
libwbclient0 - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
python-samba - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
registry-tools - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
samba - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
samba-common - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
samba-common-bin - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
samba-libs - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
samba-testsuite - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
smbclient - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
winbind - 2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:4.1.6+dfsg-1ubuntu2.14.04.13').
